events.comment: The rendering is set to nearest neighbor to support the small assets that are being scaled
At the beginning, CurrentKey is set to Random number below 26 (including 26).
An array called keys store all the key characters, and CurrentKey represents a index in that array. Consider this as a library that binds all the characters to a value

We cross check the instance variable "key" of "keys" (object group that includes all the key objects) to the "key" array with the index of CurrentKey, if the values are same, the animation is set to 1, else, set to 0
We check if the expression string of the index CurrentKey of Key is pressed, then Randomize the CurrentKey, Add 1 to KeyCounter, CorrectAnswer is set to true and play a sound
We check if keys instance with it's "key" instance variable is equal to the index CurrentKey of Key is clicked, then Randomize the CurrentKey, Add 1 to KeyCounter, and play an sound of error.
We check if CorrectAnswer is false (meaning that the key pressed was not correct)
The variable Correct Answer is reset (set back to false) when any keys is released and mouse button released
After 60 seconds from start of the scene, go to game over screen
Display the message how many keys have been pressed
